title: Request for Body Cam Footage

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the DUI arrest of a woman who was found passed out at a red light in Hillsborough County, Florida, on St. Patrick's Day, 03/18/2024.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 03/18/2024
Location: Hillsborough County, Florida
Suspect: [suspect's name, if known]
Incident Summary: The woman was found unconscious at the wheel of her car at a red light after a night of drinking. She was unable to identify her location and failed a sobriety test before being arrested for DUI.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the scene and interacted with the suspect during the investigation and arrest.

I request the following:

Bodycam footage from all responding officers.
Any related dashcam footage if available.
Any additional audio or video footage related to the incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: September 14
Location: Jackson-Olin High School football field, Birmingham, Alabama
Suspect: director at Minor High School
Incident Summary: Following the end of a football game between Jackson-Olin High School and Minor High School, the Minor High School band continued playing music for at least 18 minutes after the game concluded. The band director was confronted by police officers after refusing to stop the performance. Bodycam footage shows the band director arguing with officers and telling them to "get out of my face," before being restrained and tasered. The director was later treated at the scene and transported to a local hospital. He was charged with disorderly conduct, harassment, and resisting arrest.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the incident at Jackson-Olin High School, including any footage that shows the interaction between the band director and police officers, as well as any subsequent actions leading to his arrest.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the arrest of Cori Lynne Ralston following a stabbing incident in Clermont, Florida.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date:  September 4, 2022
Location: Lake Ridge Circle, Clermont, Florida
Suspect: Cori Lynne Ralston, 18
Incident Summary: Deputies responded to Lake Ridge Circle after South Lake Hospital reported that a stabbing victim had left the emergency room without receiving treatment. Upon arrival, deputies found the victim sweating profusely and suffering from a deep stab wound that required transport to Orlando Regional Medical Center as a trauma alert. Initial statements from the victim’s mother falsely claimed the injury was accidental, but another relative later reported hearing an argument between the victim and Ralston. Deputies questioned Ralston, who admitted to arguing with the victim, spraying each other with a kitchen faucet, and then waving a knife, which ultimately stabbed the victim. Due to the severity of the injury, Ralston was arrested for aggravated battery with a deadly weapon and booked into the Lake County Jail.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the incident, including footage of the initial response, witness statements, and the suspect’s questioning.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Suspects: Dixie Stiles, 18, and Macy Regan, 23
Incident Summary: Deputies responded to an assault and battery call at 6530 Olokee St. An investigation determined that an unsupervised house party was occurring at 6526 Olokee St. Just after midnight, a physical altercation took place between Dixie Stiles and Macy Regan after Stiles accused Regan of stealing alcohol and vape pens. Regan allegedly pulled out a 9mm handgun before Stiles shoved it away, leading to a physical fight in which Regan bit off the top of Stiles’ ear. I am requesting copies of body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the incident.

title: Sidney Mecham Case

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Sidney Mecham Case
communications.communication:
Jordan Lassiter
February 23, 2025

FOIA Officer
Portland Police Bureau
1111 SW 2nd Ave
Portland, OR 97204

Subject: Public Records Request – Sidney Mecham Case (Closed) & Demand for Record Preservation

DISCLAIMER:

Please read this FOIA request carefully and abide by all requested points. All communications regarding this request are public and will be disclosed as appropriate.

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law (ORS 192.311 – 192.478), I request access to the following records related to Sidney Mecham’s arrest, investigation, and prosecution for driving through the closed Rose Festival Grand Floral Parade on June 10, 2023. Mecham was convicted and sentenced to five years in prison, making all related law enforcement records subject to public disclosure.

I formally demand the preservation of all responsive records, including but not limited to:
	•	Body-worn camera footage
	•	Dashcam recordings
	•	911 call recordings and transcripts
	•	Police dispatch logs
	•	Arrest reports and investigative files
	•	Internal police communications related to the case

Destroying, altering, or withholding these records without legal justification could constitute a violation of public records law and a due process violation under Chaudhry v. City of Los Angeles, 751 F.3d 1096 (9th Cir. 2014). Further, Public Citizen v. U.S. Dept. of Justice, 491 U.S. 440 (1989) reaffirms the public’s right to government transparency.

1. Body-Worn Camera (BWC) Footage

Requested Records:
	•	All footage from officers who responded to Sidney Mecham’s incident on June 10, 2023.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 133.741 requires law enforcement to retain and disclose BWC footage unless exempt.
	•	ACLU of Nevada v. City of Las Vegas, 333 F.3d 1092 (9th Cir. 2003) confirmed that police bodycam recordings are subject to public records laws.
	•	Reference: ORS 133.741

2. Dashcam Footage

Requested Records:
	•	All police vehicle dashcam recordings related to Mecham’s arrest.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.345(3) requires disclosure of police video records unless they interfere with an active case, which is not applicable here.
	•	Hayden v. City of Portland, 183 Or App 647 (2002) established mandatory disclosure of non-exempt police records.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.345(3)

3. 911 Call Recordings and Transcripts

Requested Records:
	•	All 911 call recordings and transcripts related to Mecham’s actions and arrest.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.345(3) states that 911 calls are public records unless an exemption applies.
	•	State v. Worthington, 138 Or App 104 (1995) upheld that 911 call transcripts must be disclosed unless privacy outweighs public interest.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.345(3)

4. Police Dispatch Audio and Transcripts

Requested Records:
	•	All officer-dispatch communications related to Sidney Mecham’s arrest.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.311 provides for the disclosure of police communication records.
	•	New York Times Co. v. NASA, 852 F.2d 602 (D.C. Cir. 1988) affirmed that public agencies must disclose internal communications unless an exemption applies.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.311

5. Arrest and Booking Reports

Requested Records:
	•	Complete arrest and booking reports related to Mecham’s case, including officer narratives.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.345(3) mandates disclosure of completed law enforcement reports.
	•	Afshar v. Dept. of State, 702 F.2d 1125 (D.C. Cir. 1983) held that agencies must disclose non-exempt portions of law enforcement records.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.345(3)

6. Investigative Case Files & Final Police Reports

Requested Records:
	•	All finalized investigative reports, officer statements, and internal police memos regarding the Mecham case.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.345(3) confirms that records in closed cases are subject to public disclosure.
	•	Landano v. U.S. Dept. of Justice, 508 U.S. 165 (1993) held that FBI investigative reports must be disclosed unless explicitly exempted.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.345(3)

7. Mugshot and Booking Photos

Requested Records:
	•	Any official mugshot taken of Sidney Mecham at the time of his arrest.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.355 allows for the disclosure of booking photos unless explicitly exempted.
	•	Detroit Free Press v. DOJ, 829 F.3d 478 (6th Cir. 2016) held that mugshots are public records unless there is a compelling exemption.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.355

Request for Fee Waiver

Pursuant to ORS 192.324(5), I request a waiver of all fees as this request serves the public interest in promoting transparency regarding law enforcement actions and public safety policies.
	•	Public Citizen v. Dept. of Justice, 491 U.S. 440 (1989) held that government information disclosure fosters accountability.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.324(5)

Preservation of Records

I formally demand that all responsive records be preserved under:
	•	44 U.S.C. § 3106 (prohibiting unlawful destruction of public records).
	•	5 U.S.C. § 552 (ensuring preservation of records subject to FOIA requests).

Conclusion

If this request is denied in whole or in part, please provide:
	•	A written explanation citing the specific FOIA exemptions invoked.
	•	All segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

Please confirm receipt of this request and provide an estimated timeline for processing. If clarification is needed, I can be reached at Jordan@Lassiter.eu.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Investigative Journalist 
Jordan@Lassiter.eu

title: 911 Police Dispatch

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: 911 Police Dispatch
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. An accounting of all calls for service (sometimes referred to as "dispatch logs") between the dates of 1/1/20 and 1/31/25. Please provide these in the format in which they are stored in your system, which may be a database, spreadsheet, CSV file, or similar. The format may also be the same as Allegheny County’s 911 dispatches for EMS and Fire, which are published to WPRDC: https://data.wprdc.org/dataset/allegheny-county-911-dispatches-ems-and-fire
The database may include, but not be limited to, properties relating to: call date and time; origin of the call (police-initiated, 911 call, 311 call, etc.); who was dispatched; call disposition; call resolution time.
2. A data dictionary describing the properties present in the table, and how they relate to other records such as published incidents or arrests.
3. Any additional training materials or documentation for how this data is created, or how it should be used internally.

If any part of the request cannot be met, please proceed with the remaining parts.

If any part of the request is denied, please cite the law under which the denial is allowed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Josh Chamberlain

title: AI Use in Federal Workforce Evaluations for Research Purposes (Department of Justice, Office of Information Policy)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request under 5 U.S.C. § 552 as part of a policy research project examining the role of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and data analytics in federal workforce evaluation and monitoring. This request is being made to gather publicly available information on AI-driven workforce management tools and policy discussions related to their implementation.  

Requested Records:

1. Documents discussing the use of AI in federal workforce monitoring & evaluation
   - Any memos, reports, internal emails, or policy discussions related to AI, machine learning, or predictive analytics used for employee performance tracking, workforce assessments, or compliance monitoring.  
   - Any internal or external studies commissioned by OPM, DOJ, or EOUSA regarding the use of AI to optimize or evaluate employee performance.

2. Contracts, agreements, or procurement records related to AI-driven workforce tools
   - Any vendor contracts, third-party technology procurements, or government-developed AI tools used for workforce compliance and evaluation.  
   - Documentation on any partnerships with private sector firms, universities, or think tanks to research or implement AI in workforce monitoring.  

3. Legal & policy discussions regarding AI in workforce compliance
   - Any legal opinions, Attorney General reviews, or internal agency discussions on whether AI-driven workforce evaluations align with federal hiring protections under 5 U.S.C. § 2301 and due process requirements under 5 U.S.C. § 7701.
   - Any assessments on the ethical implications of using AI in workforce evaluations, including any risk evaluations related to bias or disparate impact.

I request records from January 1, 2024, to the present in electronic format (PDF or machine-readable format).  If any records are withheld, please provide a Vaughn Index listing the withheld documents and the exemption(s) claimed.  

This request is part of an independent policy research project analyzing the integration of AI in federal workforce operations. It is not related to litigation, investigative reporting, or law enforcement oversight. If any clarification is needed, please contact me before denying any portion of this request.  

Thank you for your time, and I look forward to your response within the 20-business-day timeframe required by 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i).

Sincerely,

Taylor S. Reed

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Use of Illinois Arts Council funding for Evanston, IL
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

According to the National Endowment for The Arts (N.E.A.) grant search, the Illinois Arts Council (I.A.C.) receives annual grants from the N.E.A.. For the Grant Period 07/2024 - 12/2025 the NEA reports a grant of $1,146,200. 

This N.E.A. money funds I.A.C. programs in various capacities. It can be inferred, for example, that at the city level, some of this funding is provided to the City of Evanston through the Evanston Arts Council (E.A.C.). 

The specific breakdown of how these funds are divided up is not publicly available. The I.A.C. website instructs individuals to file a F.O.I.A. for cases where this information is desired. 

That said, I request all communication between the Illinois Arts Council and the City of Evanston (including the E.A.C.) regarding grant money from June 2024 to the time that this request is processed. 

Additionally, it would be greatly appreciated if you provided a detailed breakdown of N.E.A. funding allocated to the city of Evanston during this same time frame. 

If applicable, I request that fees be waived as documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sol Thomas

title: FLHSMV UTC Data Request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

An export of data from all tables of Uniform Traffic Citation (UTC), Driving Under the Influence (DUI) UTC, UTC Disposition, Arrest- Offense data Fail to Comply (FTC) (D6), and Criminal Financial Oblication data from Florida's Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles Citation/Adjudication Data System. I am requesting data starting in 2011 through the most recent year with full data availability in the system.

From my research I believe that UTC data is administered by the FLHSMV based on the statutory authority 316.650, F.S. [found here: https://www.flsenate.gov/Laws/Statutes/2017/316.650] and 322.20, F.S. [found here: http://m.flsenate.gov/laws/statutes/2018/322.20]. Based on information found in the Uniform Traffic Citation Procedures Manual [found here: https://www.flhsmv.gov/pdf/courts/utc/utccombinedmanual.pdf], the eCitation Interface Control Document [found here: https://www.flhsmv.gov/pdf/courts/utc/eCitation_Interface_Control_Document_6.1.pdf], the Traffic Citation Accounting Transmission System (TCATS) Interface Control Document (ICD) [found here: https://www.flhsmv.gov/pdf/courts/utc/tcats_icd_6_0_1.pdf] and the Uniform Traffic Citation Training presentation [found here: https://www.flhsmv.gov/pdf/courts/utc/2021_trcc_utc_grant_workshop.pdf] I understand UTC data is transmitted from issuing law enforcement agencies within five days of the offence date to the Florida Clerks of the Court (COC) for processing and are then validated and transferred via the Florida Court Clerks & Comptroller's Association (FCCC) Traffic Citation Accounting Transmission System (TCATS) to the FLHSMV within 10 days of disposition.

My request is for the validated UTC and disposition data that the FLHSMV currently has in its database(s). My request is for all non-exempt columns from tables in the FLHSMV citation/adjudication database which based on my research should include but is not limited to:

I am also requesting any resources the FLHSMV has that documents the data in its Motor Vehicles Citation/Adjudication Data System such as but not limited to data dictionaries, database documentation files, data logs, appendices or other supplementary informational materials.

I request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, we additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

Sincerely,

Adrian Nesta

title: Request for Critical Incident Body-Worn Camera Footage (Incident date: 4/10/2024) (Department of Justice, United States Marshals)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident: 

Incident Date: April 10, 2024
Location: 6600 block of W William Cannon Dr, Austin, Texas
Victim Name: Name Withheld 

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. In addition, we request that the name of the victim be released as well.

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson
